Sponsored By Restaurant Operations Menu Trends Restaurant Concepts & Chefs Taking control of the seafood supply Taking control of the seafood supply Taking control of the seafood supply King‚Äôs Seafood keeps costs at bay by cutting out the middle man Nancy Luna , Senior editor, Nation's Restaurant News July 6, 2018 5 Min Read On a busy Wednesday morning, employees at King‚Äôs Seafood Distribution Co. unload dozens of fresh fish shipped from around the world to its Southern California warehouse. This time of year, the warehouse is overflowing with whole fish, oysters, clams and live crustaceans that come from as far away as New Zealand and Chile ‚Äî and as close as Newport Beach, Calif., about 10 miles from the 15,000-square foot warehouse tucked in a nondescript industrial zone. More Direct to Source stories: Produce: The farmer as restaurant partner >> Meat: New York burger joint builds business around single-source meat >> On this day, a team of Food and Drug Administration employees have just left the Santa Ana, Calif. warehouse. They‚Äôre not inspecting. They‚Äôre training. The distribution center, which serves 21 restaurants owned by King‚Äôs Seafood Co., has proven to be a top-notch training facility for inspectors learning guidelines for similar facilities in Mexico. ‚ÄúWhat better validation than that,‚Äù said Sam King, owner of both the Santa Ana distribution center, and the family-run King‚Äôs Seafood Co., based in Costa Mesa, Calif. Local sanddabs from Newport Beach. For King, the distribution arm is proving ground for the old adage: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself. When the Great Recession hit in 2008, King‚Äôs Seafood halted growth of its main concepts, Water Grill and King‚Äôs Fish House. King, founder and CEO of the company, decided to pivot by opening up his own distribution center to supply his California, Arizona, Nevada and Texas restaurants. Plant operations director Juan Vargas holds fresh caught salmon. The advantage: Supplying 21 restaurants reduces kitchen labor costs, provides razor-sharp quality control, and keeps food costs in check. ‚ÄúThis is a dream we‚Äôve always had,‚Äù he said. King and his management crew gave Restaurant Hospitality an exclusive tour of the distribution center. The warehouse receives product four times a week from local fishmongers and large suppliers from around the world. On this day, fish cutters are filleting a 250-pound swordfish into about 100 portions that will be distributed to the company‚Äôs seafood restaurants. By centralizing the filleting in the 32-degree ‚ÄúFin Fish Room,‚Äù King said he controls product quality and cost. ¬†If he didn‚Äôt have the distribution center, each of his 21 restaurants would have to hire and train a cook to filet fish in-house. But, instead, he has nine employees cutting portions to specifications needed at each restaurant. ‚ÄúOur best fish cutters are right here,‚Äù King said. That saves on labor, but more importantly, the process means the seafood is handled by fewer people and is portioned in a controlled environment to maintain consistency. Santa Barbara spot prawns are in season, and served the King‚Äôs Seafood restaurants including Water Grill. That‚Äôs crucial for a high-volume seafood company, whose restaurants serve about 1 million pounds of fresh fish a year, he said. And that number continues to grow for the 34-year-old privately-held company. King and his cousin Jeff, who passed away last year, are next generation restaurant operators. Their fathers, Lou and Mickey King, were also restaurateurs. The cousins teamed up in 1984 to open 555 East Steakhouse in Long Beach, Calif. Sam and Jeff King went on to open seven concepts under the King‚Äôs Seafood Company umbrella. Company banners include Water Grill (5 locations in downtown Los Angeles; Costa Mesa, Calif.; Santa Monica, Calf.; San Diego and Dallas); casual-dining chain King‚Äôs Fish House (11 locations in California, Arizona and Nevada); Meat on Ocean in Santa Monica; Lou & Mickey‚Äôs in San Diego; 555 East American Steakhouse in Long Beach, Calif.; fast-casual Fish Camp in Sunset Beach, Calif.; and Pier Burger at the Santa Monica Pier. Over the last two years, the company has invested millions opening more locations of its premium fine-dining brand, Water Grill. New restaurants have opened in Dallas and Costa Mesa, Calif. ¬†Two more are on the books for Las Vegas, in 2019, and Denver, in 2020. The Las Vegas restaurant will be in the high-profile spot previously held by Wolfgang Puck‚Äôs Spago at The Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. Water Grill‚Äôs menu is updated daily to reflect the freshest seafood delivered to the distribution center. Because the center buys at a large scale, King said he gets a better price and first choice of some exclusive catches, such as Pacific Sanddabs and oysters from as far away as Prince Edward Island, Canada. The seafood distribution center also acts as the company‚Äôs distribution center more broadly. Everything from soup crackers to oils and paper goods are delivered to the site, then re-distributed along with the fish, to each restaurant. This saves King‚Äôs Seafood from paying suppliers to truck the goods directly to stores. King‚Äôs Seafood Distribution Co. sources its fish from around the world. Its vast network means they can offer diners a wide range of seasonal seafood. ‚ÄúWe want to get rid of the middle guy,‚Äù said Juan Vargas, director of plant operations. The consumer benefits in several ways. The supply-yourself model saves the restaurants about 10 percent on food costs. That helps keep menu prices reasonable as the company faces costs they can‚Äôt control, such as mandatory minimum-wage hikes, which vary from state to state and city to city, King said. Diners, King said, experience an unmatched choice of fresh fish from around the world because the company‚Äôs network is wide. The Water Grill menu in late June, for example, featured whole-fish options of wild Brittany Dover sole (priced at $46 a pound), wild Rhode Island black seabass ($39 a pound), farmed Loup de Mer European bass ($32 a pound) and wild New Zealand pink bream ($31 a pound). Tank options included jumbo wild Maryland soft-shell crabs, a main entr√©e dish, priced at $34 and wild Santa Barbara spot prawns for $50 a pound. With reports of rampant seafood fraud in recent years, King said transparency on the menu is part of the brand‚Äôs ethos of serving seafood responsibly. ‚ÄúWe want people to trust they‚Äôre getting the seafood they are paying for,‚Äù King said. Contact Nancy Luna at [email¬†protected] Follow her on Twitter: @FastFoodMaven About the Author Nancy Luna Senior editor, Nation's Restaurant News Nancy Luna is a senior editor at Nation's Restaurant News and a contributing editor at Supermarket News. She covers the industry's largest and most talked about fast-food brands including McDonald's, Starbucks, Chipotle Mexican Grill, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, KFC and Subway. She is an award-winning journalist with more than 25 years reporting experience. As a veteran business reporter based in Southern California, Nancy has covered some of the country's most beloved food and retail brands including In-N-Out, Taco Bell, Trader Joe's, Aldi, Whole Foods Market, Target and Costco. Luna is a graduate of Cal State Fullerton. When she's not digging for news on her beat, you can find Nancy regaling her fans about her latest dining adventures on her Fast Food Maven social media channels. Contact [email¬†protected] or¬†follow her on Twitter at https://twitter.com/fastfoodmaven See more from Nancy Luna Subscribe to Our Newsletters Get the latest breaking news in the industry, analysis, research, recipes, consumer trends, the latest products and more. shareholders As of 1st September 2025 Edit Investor Name Holding Stake Creadev International S.A.S 31,502,502 22.1% ASR Nederland 21,419,870 15.0% Rabo Participaties B.V. 17,813,233 12.5% Stolt-Nielsen M.S. Ltd 17,552,236 12.3% Bank Julius B√§r & Co. AG 8,426.559 5.9% Claris BV 8,248,957 5.8% Pershing LLC 4,072,138 2.9% Kleinfeld, N. 3,536,771 2.5% Silver Oak Investments Holding C.V 2,880,241 2.0% JPMorgan Chase Bank 2,692,983 1.9% BM Invest BV 2,171,331 1.5% Nutreco International B.V. 1,954,958 1.4% Grober, E. 1,866,108 1.3% Cibus Enterprises Fund LP 1,782,742 1.2% Selzer Investments 1,641,990 1.2% Corporate governance Management board Vincent Erenst Vincent Erenst brings a strong international, operational, and transformational track record with more than 35 years of experience leading aquaculture companies. Most recently, he worked as Chief Operating Officer at Barramundi Group. Prior to this role, he worked as COO of Avramar and for more than 10 years he worked as Managing Director of Mowi Canada West, where he was responsible for strong profit growth through an increase of harvest volumes, efficiency improvements and strengthening of the market position in North America. Jean-Charles Valette Jean-Charles Valette has held various financial leadership positions at food and production companies, both in listed and private environments. Most recently, he worked as the Vice-President Finance of Dott, a fast growing scale-up. Prior to this role, he worked as senior Vice-President Finance for CEVA Logistics, where he was directly involved in generating USD 1.2 billion through a successful IPO on the SIX Swiss stock exchange. Jean-Charles brings great added value towards building, growing and transforming companies. Furthermore, he has strong expertise in corporate finance, process optimizations and transformations. Supervisory board Jeroen Scheelbeek Mr. Scheelbeek (1968) is the Chairman of the Supervisory Board and served on the company‚Äôs 1-tier board of directors prior to the conversion of the company to a public limited liability company. Mr. Scheelbeek currently works at Bauhinia, an independent financial advisory boutique firm. In addition, he acts as senior financial advisor to the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs. He is also board member and chairman of the risk committee of Moza Banco, a regulated financial institution in Mozambique. Mr. Scheelbeek served, amongst other roles, as global head of structured finance, head of corporate clients and head of corporate finance Asia, in the Rabobank wholesale clients division. He has also acted as member of the highest credit risk committees of the bank. Mr. Scheelbeek has participated in executive management courses at Harvard, IMD, Insead and Kellogg University. He holds a Master‚Äôs degree in Business Administration from the Free University of Amsterdam. Mr. Scheelbeek is also a member of the Supervisory Board of Protix. Xavier Govare Mr. Govare is an accomplished senior executive with over three decades of experience in the food industry, including 15 years as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Labeyrie Fine Foods. Throughout his tenure, he successfully transformed the company into a leading international food group, increasing revenue from ‚Ç¨30 million to ‚Ç¨1.1 billion and completing 12 strategic acquisitions. He is recognized for his expertise in strategic vision, marketing, brand development, and financial and operational management. Mr. Govare has extensive experience in managing industrial operations across Europe and navigating complex shareholder structures, including listed companies, LBOs, and private ownership. He currently serves as a board director for several organizations in the agri-food and packaging sectors. Hans den Bieman Mr. Den Bieman (1959) served as the company‚Äôs former (interim) CEO and Chairman of the Board. He is currently a shareholder and director of Sealand ‚Äì the largest smolt producer in Chile. Amongst various top management positions in the field, Mr. Den Bieman served as COO of Nutreco Aquaculture (2000‚Äì2005) and as CEO of the Netherlands-based Marine Harvest, the world‚Äôs largest fish-farming company, listed on Oslo B√∏rs (now Mowi ASA) (2005‚Äì2007). He holds a Master‚Äôs degree in Aquaculture (Msc,) from Wageningen University. Via his personal holding company, Mr. Den Bieman held 2 171 331 shares in the capital of the company on 31 December 2024. Jordi Trias Fita Mr. Trias Fita (1977) became President of Stolt Sea Farm in January 2018 after joining the business as Managing Director in 2016. Prior to this he spent 14 years with GBFoods, where he held several positions in marketing, sales and business unit management, located in Spain, Kazakhstan, Russia, Ukraine and Senegal. Mr. Trias Fita holds a degree in Business Administration from the University of Barcelona, a Master‚Äôs degree in marketing, and an MBA from the Instituto de Empresa. He is a citizen of Spain. Mr. Trias Fita held no shares in the capital of the company on the Record Date. Mr. Trias Fita also serves as a President of Stolt Sea Farm, part of Stolt-Nielsen M.S. Ltd which owns ~8,3% of the shares in the capital of the company on 31 December 2024. Noam Kleinfeld Mr. Kleinfeld (1977) acted as Managing Director at HSBC Investment Bank, with over 16 years of experience in cross-border M&A, Corporate Finance, Equity/Debt Capital Markets, Leverage Acquisition Finance, Project Finance and Corporate/Debt Restructuring. Further, Mr. Kleinfeld is a co-founder of several businesses, including The Griffin Fund, a leading real estate player in Atlanta‚Äôs multifamily segment. Mr. Kleinfeld is an active venture capital investor in early-stage companies with a large TAM, unique technological edge, and strong execution capabilities. Mr. Kleinfeld holds a BA in Business Administration with a Major in Finance from Reichman University. Mr. Kleinfeld held 3 247 883 shares in the capital of the company on 31 December 2024. New CEO for The Kingfish Company - The Kingfish Company Home Product Sustainability News Investors Recipes Career FAQ/Contact English Dutch French German Italian Spanish Select Page New CEO for The Kingfish Company The Kingfish Company 2 January 2023 The Kingfish Company [Euronext: KING], a pioneer in sustainable land-based aquaculture, has selected Vincent Erenst as Chief Executive Officer, effective February 6th, 2023. The Kingfish Company will recommend the appointment of Vincent Erenst as Chief Executive Officer at an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGM), to be held early 2023. ‚ÄúWe are very pleased to propose Vincent Erenst as the new CEO of The Kingfish Company. He has an impressive track record in driving performance improvements and value creation across a broad range of businesses in the aquaculture sector. We are convinced that Vincent is a very suitable CEO to bring The Kingfish Company to the next level of performance. On behalf of the Supervisory Board, I welcome him as the next CEO of The Kingfish Company, and we wish him success in his new role to further shape The Kingfish Company while playing a key role in driving the strategy and reinforcing the market position of our company‚Äù, said Jeroen Scheelbeek, the Chairman of The Kingfish Company. a The Kingfish Company [Euronext: KING], a pioneer in sustainable land-based aquaculture, has selected Vincent Erenst as Chief Executive Officer, effective February 6th, 2023. The Kingfish Company will recommend the appointment of Vincent Erenst as Chief Executive Officer at an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGM), to be held early 2023. ‚ÄúWe are very pleased to propose Vincent Erenst as the new CEO of The Kingfish Company. He has an impressive track record in driving performance improvements and value creation across a broad range of businesses in the aquaculture sector. We are convinced that Vincent is a very suitable CEO to bring The Kingfish Company to the next level of performance. On behalf of the Supervisory Board, I welcome him as the next CEO of The Kingfish Company, and we wish him success in his new role to further shape The Kingfish Company while playing a key role in driving the strategy and reinforcing the market position of our company‚Äù, said Jeroen Scheelbeek, the Chairman of The Kingfish Company. Vincent brings a strong international, operational and transformational track record with more than 35 years of experience leading aquaculture companies. Most recently, he worked as Chief Operating Officer at Barramundi Group. Prior to this role, he worked as COO of Avramar and for more than 10 years he worked as Managing Director of Mowi Canada West. ‚ÄúI am thrilled to take on this new challenge and responsibility. With a best-in-class product, cutting edge RAS technology and a strong and motivated team, The Kingfish Company is perfectly positioned to further implement its growth strategy. I am very proud to take the lead of a great team and will put all my efforts into getting The Kingfish Company to the next level in the coming years‚Äù, said Vincent Erenst. For media and investor inquiries, please contact: n press@the-kingfish-company.com ir@the-kingfish-company.com About The Kingfish Company N.V. n The Kingfish Company is a pioneer and leader in sustainable land-based aquaculture. Current annual production capacity at its Kingfish Zeeland facility in the Netherlands is 1,500 tons of high quality and high value Yellowtail Kingfish. Expansion is underway and capacity in the Netherlands is expected to reach 3,500 tons in Q1 2023. Kingfish Maine is now fully permitted by local, state and federal regulatory agencies. n Production is based on advanced recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS), which protect biodiversity and ensure biosecurity. Animal welfare is paramount, and the fish is grown without use of antibiotics and vaccines. Operations run on 100 percent renewable energy, sourced from wind, solar and biogas. The Company‚Äôs facilities operate on sea water, avoiding wasting of precious fresh water. The Kingfish Company‚Äôs main product at present, the Yellowtail Kingfish (also known as Ricciola/Hiramasa/Greater Amberjack) is a highly versatile premium fish species, well known in the Italian and Asian fusion cuisines. Its products are certified and approved as sustainable and environmentally friendly by Aquaculture Stewardship Council (ASC), Best Aquaculture Practices (BAP) and British Retail Consortium (BRC). It was the winner of the 2019 Seafood Excellence Award, and it is recommended as green choice by Good Fish Foundation. Vincent brings a strong international, operational and transformational track record with more than 35 years of experience leading aquaculture companies. Most recently, he worked as Chief Operating Officer at Barramundi Group. Prior to this role, he worked as COO of Avramar and for more than 10 years he worked as Managing Director of Mowi Canada West. ‚ÄúI am thrilled to take on this new challenge and responsibility. With a best-in-class product, cutting edge RAS technology and a strong and motivated team, The Kingfish Company is perfectly positioned to further implement its growth strategy. I am very proud to take the lead of a great team and will put all my efforts into getting The Kingfish Company to the next level in the coming years‚Äù, said Vincent Erenst. For media and investor inquiries, please contact: n press@the-kingfish-company.com ir@the-kingfish-company.com About The Kingfish Company N.V. n The Kingfish Company is a pioneer and leader in sustainable land-based aquaculture. Current annual production capacity at its Kingfish Zeeland facility in the Netherlands is 1,500 tons of high quality and high value Yellowtail Kingfish. Expansion is underway and capacity in the Netherlands is expected to reach 3,500 tons in Q1 2023. Kingfish Maine is now fully permitted by local, state and federal regulatory agencies. n Production is based on advanced recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS), which protect biodiversity and ensure biosecurity. Animal welfare is paramount, and the fish is grown without use of antibiotics and vaccines. Operations run on 100 percent renewable energy, sourced from wind, solar and biogas. The Company‚Äôs facilities operate on sea water, avoiding wasting of precious fresh water. The Kingfish Company‚Äôs main product at present, the Yellowtail Kingfish (also known as Ricciola/Hiramasa/Greater Amberjack) is a highly versatile premium fish species, well known in the Italian and Asian fusion cuisines. Its products are certified and approved as sustainable and environmentally friendly by Aquaculture Stewardship Council (ASC), Best Aquaculture Practices (BAP) and British Retail Consortium (BRC). It was the winner of the 2019 Seafood Excellence Award, and it is recommended as green choice by Good Fish Foundation. Contact / FAQ's - The Kingfish Company Home Product Sustainability News Investors Recipes Career FAQ/Contact English Dutch French German Italian Spanish Select Page FAQs Is your fish safe to eat raw? Our processing plant is BRC certified and we have ASC, FoS and BAP Chain of Custody. We guarantee quality and cold chain from processing plant to retailer, but advise consumers to only eat raw fish when prepared by a qualified chef if the cold chain was not compromised. Is your fish fresh or frozen? We sell both fresh and frozen whole fish, fillets, and portions. Frozen fish should be placed in the fridge to thaw if being consumed at home. Please consume within two days of thawing. Does your fish contain any allergens? CONTAINS: FISH However, our fish does not share processing lines with any other allergens like shellfish or nuts. Is your fish healthy? CONTAINS: FISH Fish is a fantastic source of high-quality protein and heart-healthy omega 3 fatty acids. Raising fish in a well managed environment means no contaminants. Our fish can be enjoyed regulary as part of a healthy diet. Where can I buy your fish? Contact our sales team at order@thekingfishcompany.com for wholesale, distribution, and retail information. Does your fish contain GMOs, vaccines, or antibiotics? Our processing plant is BRC certified and we have ASC, FoS and BAP Chain of Custody. We guarantee quality and cold chain from processing plant to retailer, but advise consumers to only eat raw fish when prepared by a qualified chef if the cold chain was not compromised. Our locations The Kingfish Company is operating at the cutting edge of sustainable, land based, high value marine aquaculture in the EU and the US. Based in the Dutch province of Zeeland, Kingfish Zeeland taps into the pristine marine estuary water of the Eastern Scheldt, a Natura 2000 nature reserve, to deliver a healthy, antibiotic-free premium delicacy: The Kingfish Company Yellowtail (Seriola Lalandi / Dutch Yellowtail / Hiramasa / often used interchangeably with close cousin Hamachi). The Kingfish Company Zeeland, NL With an optimally located site near Chandler Bay, Jonesport, Kingfish Maine will be servicing the US market daily.¬†The Kingfish Company is a first mover operating at the cutting edge of sustainable, land based, high value marine aquaculture in the EU and the US. Opening Hours: Monday to Saturday: 12:00 PM ‚Äì 9:00 PM (Kitchen closes at 9:00 PM) Summer hours:July- Sundays Open from 10:00am ‚Äì 9:00pm August Sundays Open From 12:00pm  -9:00pm Stay updated with our latest news and specials by following us on Facebook and Instagram! A Family Tradition Since 1976 In 1976, our parents, Mike and Cathy, opened a small fish & chip shop on Dublin‚Äôs Parnell Street. Over the past 47 years, our family restaurant has grown into one of Dublin‚Äôs most beloved spots for traditional Irish food. As one of the last remaining family-run restaurants in the heart of the city, we take great pride in sourcing only the freshest ingredients, traveling across Ireland to hand-pick the finest produce for our dishes. We even grow our own potatoes on our family farm! We believe in fresh, homemade food: Our breads are baked fresh every morning. Our chips are hand-cut daily. We squeeze our own fresh orange juice. And of course, we bake our own delicious desserts! But what we truly pride ourselves on is our fish. For over 47 years, we‚Äôve been perfecting our signature Fish & Chips, along with other classic dishes like salmon, plaice, ray, and sea bass, cooked in a variety of styles that have kept locals and tourists coming back for generations. Step inside, and you‚Äôll find a warm and inviting space, filled with the comforting aroma of fresh, home-cooked food. Our restaurant is a place where everyone feels welcome‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre a regular, a first-time visitor, or just passing through Dublin. With a friendly team, a relaxed atmosphere, and a passion for great food, we‚Äôve created a genuine home-from-home dining experience where quality, tradition, and hospitality come together. We look forward to welcoming you soon! Opening Times We Are Open for Business! Join us for indoor dining or enjoy our newly opened outdoor terrace‚Äîboth open from 12:00 PM to 9:00 PM, Monday to Saturday. Closed on Sundays & Bank Holiday Mondays Last kitchen orders at 9:00 PM No table bookings required, except for groups of 8 or more. For group reservations, please contact us: üìû Phone: 01 872 8732 üìß Email: kingfisherdublin167@gmail.com We look forward to welcoming you! WHAT OUR CUSTOMERS SAY It‚Äôs nice to have a quiet coffee at ‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs nice to have a quiet coffee at the family run Kingfisher and experience a bit of the friendly Dublin buzz Michael Buble, Canada The Best Fish n‚Äô chips in Dublin! We loved this restaurant! we tried other fish and chips but this one beated them all! Very very recommended. Also the salmon was very good. Try the irish breakfast too! Pietro, Italy Went twice in one day! This place was so great! We went for breakfast and dinner in the same day. The service was great and both times we went it was packed. The prices are very reasonable and the resturant is very cute and has the homemade feel I love! Natalie Good Irish breakfast and great fish & chips We stayed at the Kingfisher townhouse and had breakfast and lunch at the restaurant. The full Irish breakfast my wife ordered was good and an omelette I ordered was also good. For lunch my wife and myself ordered the fish and chips and WOW‚Ä¶ that was an amazing dish! Probably among the best fish & chips I‚Äôve eaten. Patricio, USA Super place!! My wife and I stayed in the guest house while in Dublin for a concert and found it to be excellent. The room was clean and quiet and the staff were friendly and helpful even allowing us to leave our cases in reception for a few hours while we shopped. As for breakfast, Wow!! Kept us going for most of the day. Have ate here many times before and always try to go here when in Dublin as the food and service is first-class!! Would highly recommend both the guesthouse and restaurant to anyone who is visiting Dublin. Robert, Northern Ireland Great food, good value The KINGFISHER is spotless, very clean. The menu has a large range of food. Food is just beautiful, very tasty. Very good prices. 100% going back ! next time we will stay in their B&B. Sarah, Cork Liked it so much we ate there every day My grandson and I stayed in an apartment around the corner from The Kingfisher and ate there every day. The food was always fresh and delicious, and the service was friendly and efficient. In particular, the scones are exceptional, especially first thing in the morning when they‚Äôre still warm. Julie, USA Busy and Good Good food, clean and bright, full of lively people. The smoked fish fish and chips was really good. Todd, USA Amazing food It was so good, I love the new homemade lasange with the proper chipper chips. Suzanne, Limerick Freshly cooked food, especially daily fish menu! Super food, freshly cooked, very popular, almost always full, and excellent, caring, waitress service. Value for money too!! Micky, UK Great Food and Better Service My Husband and I went back to Dublin for a second time this year. We ate at the Kingfisher Restaurant last time and returned for several dinners this trip.
